text: Daniel Kahikina Akaka (September 11, 1924 - April 6, 2018) was an American politician who was a United States Senator from Hawaii from 1990 to 2013. A member of the Democratic Party, Akaka is the first U.S. Senator of Native Hawaiian ancestry. He was the Senior Senator of Hawaii for a few weeks when Daniel Inouye died in December 2012. He studied at the University of Hawaii. In 1969, he was hired by the Department of Education as a chief program planner. In the 1970s he served in various governmental positions. He was first elected to the United States House of Representatives in 1976 to represent Hawaii's Second Congressional District, and he served for 13 years. Akaka died in Honolulu of multiple organ failure on April 6, 2018 at the age of 93.Former US Sen. Daniel Akaka dies of organ failure at 93 ==References== ==Other websites== * * Category:1924 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Deaths from multiple organ failure Category:American Calvinists Category:Congregationalists Category:Politicians from Honolulu Category:United States senators from Hawaii Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians Category:University of Hawaiʻi at Mānoa alumni
title: Daniel Akaka
